Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); faded added red and added white bands; below, part of lotus bud in faded white outline with trace of red centre; exterior: in handle zone maeander; below, three bands and a single band near bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.466.b and probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.466.c and 1924,1201.517 (the obverse of the vessel has a guilloche pattern instead of a maeander pattern).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0476) (phase 2)
